title: Migrate from Docker-based workflow to pixi-based development
description:
**Context:**
Currently using Docker + docker-compose for development environment with:
- ROS2 Humble base image
- Multi-stage Dockerfile with development tools (clang, cmake, git, neovim, etc.)
- Python dependencies (matplotlib, scipy) installed via pip
- rosdep for ROS package dependencies
- colcon for workspace building
- X11 forwarding for Gazebo GUI
- User permission mapping (UID/GID)
- Build artifact caching (.colcon/build, install, log)

**Goal:**
Replace Docker workflow with pixi for faster, more reproducible development environment that:
- Provides consistent environment across machines
- Eliminates Docker build times
- Simplifies dependency management
- Maintains ROS2 Humble + Gazebo support
- Preserves X11/GUI capabilities

**Migration Tasks:**
1. Create pixi.toml with:
   - ROS2 Humble packages
   - Gazebo Classic dependencies
   - Development tools (clang, cmake, git, neovim, tmux, etc.)
   - Python dependencies (matplotlib, scipy)
   - colcon build system
   
2. Configure pixi environments:
   - Default development environment
   - Optional test/CI environment
   
3. Set up pixi tasks for common workflows:
   - Build workspace (colcon build)
   - Source setup
   - Launch Gazebo simulations
   - Run tests
   
4. Update documentation:
   - Replace Docker instructions in README.md
   - Add pixi installation guide
   - Document new workflow commands
   
5. Handle ROS-specific considerations:
   - rosdep integration for package.xml dependencies
   - Workspace sourcing in pixi shell
   - ROS_DOMAIN_ID and environment variables
   
6. Test migration:
   - Verify Gazebo simulation launches
   - Ensure colcon build works
   - Validate X11 forwarding for GUI
   - Test all existing launch files

**Current Files to Replace/Remove:**
- Dockerfile
- compose.dev.yml
- src/andino/docker/requirements.txt (if applicable)

**Files to Create:**
- pixi.toml
- .pixi/ directory (gitignored)
- Updated README.md with pixi instructions

**Success Criteria:**
- Can build ROS2 workspace using pixi
- Gazebo simulation launches successfully
- Development tools accessible
- Simpler workflow than Docker (fewer commands)
- Faster iteration time
